newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian silver up near close but gold steady.
newsitem.headline: Indian silver up near close but gold steady.

text.p: Silver prices opened higher on the back of overnight gains in the world market and were lifted further near the close by thin arrivals as well as a shortage of ready stock, dealers said.
Silver was up by 215 per kg on Thursday. Industrial demand remained low at the higher levels and some traders expected higher prices to attract profit-taking next week.

The lending cost of imported silver climbed to 7,500 rupees per kg on the upsurge in the world market. Local prices are at sizeable discounts compared to the landing cost which may curtail arrivals, one broker said.
Gold prices opened lower on the emergence of profit-taking following a fresh setback in world markets but later on, prices hovered around opening levels in thin activity.
Gold was up by 25 rupees per 10 gms on Thursday. Prices of a gold biscuit (116.50 gms) settled 200 rupees lower at 55,700 per piece. They were up by 300 rupees per piece on Thursday.
